definition: comfortable niche
content/calm/still/quiet/safe/secure/in good health/to find a place for/to install/to fix/to fit/to bring (a charge against sb)/to pacify/to harbor (good intentions)/security/safety/peace/ampere
surname An
happy/cheerful/to laugh
music
surname Le
surname Yue
nest/pit or hollow on the human body/lair/den/place/to harbor or shelter/to hold in check/to bend/classifier for litters and broods

sentences.english: This fear confined me to a narrow comfort zone.
sentences.chinese: 恐懼心理把我侷限在狹窄的安樂窩裏動彈不得。

sentences.english: I recommend people to get the hell out of your comfort zone and experience the other side.
sentences.chinese: 我建議人們離開安樂窩，去到另一個世界體驗一下。

sentences.english: It is hard to change because of the comfort zone.
sentences.chinese: 因爲安樂窩的存在，它是很難改變。

sentences.english: Of course, push yourself out of your comfort zone; that’s the only way to learn.
sentences.chinese: 當然，學習的唯一方法是把自己從安樂窩裏拽出來。

sentences.english: Describe the new and expanded comfort zone this places you in.
sentences.chinese: 描述這個你進來的新的和擴大的安樂窩的地方。

definition: time bomb
to bear and raise children
to recover/to recuperate
to support one's family (idiom); to have difficulty feeding a family
fears of trouble in the rear (idiom); family worries (obstructing freedom of action)/worries about the future consequences/often in negative expressions, meaning "no worries about anything"
self-sufficiency/autarchy
to save on food and clothing (idiom); to live frugally
to turn peril into safety (idiom); to avert a danger (esp. political or medical)
to leave one's native place, esp. against one's will (idiom)
no room to advance or to retreat (idiom); without any way out of a dilemma/trapped/in an impossible situation
foothold
to be drowned (figurative and literal)
no strategy left to try (idiom); at one's wit's end/at the end of one's tether/powerless
destitute and homeless (idiom); forced from one's home and wandering about/displaced
to contend on strong grounds/to argue strongly for what is right
to look up and see no-one familiar (idiom); not having anyone to rely on/without a friend in the world
